messages.subject: alertly swirly
messages.msgSnippet: I just wrote this to someone who s not an unschooler at all (unmarried man 30ish, SCA friend, going through a break-up and therapy, and coming to a philosophy
messages.messageBody:
I just wrote this to someone who's not an unschooler at all
(unmarried man 30ish, SCA friend, going through a break-up and
therapy, and coming to a philosophy discussion series I'm running).
First quote is his:



-=-There's been some
interesting parallels in the discussions on Wed and when I
talk with Bob.
-=-

That's because everything's connected.

And people can either be still inside, where nothing sticks (kind of
like ice, just being there, all frozen up), or can be alertly swirly,
like simmering water. When your thoughts are swirling, it seems like
everything connects to something. You're intellectually and
emotionally in motion.

Sandra
